text: Frederick Grant Banting (November 14, 1891 - February 21, 1941) was a Canadian doctor. He won the 1923 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, along with John James Richard Macleod, for the discovery of insulin Category:1891 births Category:1941 deaths Category:Canadian Nobel Prize winners Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Knights Category:Scientists from Ontario Category:Diabetes mellitus Category:Canadian physicians Category:University of Toronto alumni
title: Frederick Banting
